Boko Haram insurgency.Date: 26 July 2009 - present | (12 years, 11 months and 4 days)
Boko Haram insurgency.Location: Northern Nigeria | Northern Cameroon (from 2012) | Southeast Niger (from 2014) | Western Chad (from 2014)
Boko Haram insurgency.Status: Ongoing (Map of the current military situation) | Expansion of conflict into neighboring Cameroon, Chad, Mali, and Niger | Coalition offensive in 2015 forces Boko Haram to retreat into the Sambisa Forest | Abubakar Shekau killed on 19 May 2021 amid ISWAP's capture of Sambisa Forest
Boko Haram insurgency: Part of religious violence in Nigeria, | military intervention against ISIL, | and the War on terror

Belligerents.Multinational Joint Task Force | Nigeria: Boko Haram | (partially aligned with ISIL from 2015) | Shekau faction | Several minor factions | Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant | ISWAP | (originally Barnawi faction of Boko Haram; from 2016) | Ansaru | Supported by | al-Qaeda | AQIM | Al-Shabaab | Taliban | ISIL | (from 2015)

350,000 deaths total, of which 35,000 direct | 2,400,000 internally displaced
